questions.question: What are the three main types of memory discussed in the module?
questions.answer: Short-term, long-term, and procedural

questions.question: What is neuroplasticity?
choices: The ability of neural networks in the brain to change through growth and reorganization
The process of forming new memories
The capacity to hold information for a short period
questions.answer: The ability of neural networks in the brain to change through growth and reorganization

choices: To understand how neuroscience concepts apply to and can benefit Timorese society

questions.answer: 30 minutes

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the relationship between neuroplasticity and learning?
choices: Neuroplasticity enables the brain to change and adapt, facilitating learning
Neuroplasticity and learning are unrelated processes
Neuroplasticity only occurs in childhood, not during adult learning
questions.answer: Neuroplasticity enables the brain to change and adapt, facilitating learning

To prove that modern methods are superior

questions.answer: To identify strengths and potential areas of integration between the two approaches

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the role of cultural transmission in learning?

Proving the superiority of Western educational methods
